content:
• Wednesday, July 6, 2011
  • DRWI

    More on DragonWave (DRWI -13.4%): After getting hammered all day over the news its global head...

    More on DragonWave (DRWI -13.4%): After getting hammered all day over the news its global head of sales had departed, the company reports dismal numbers after the close, missing estimates across the board. Perhaps there's a good reason he left. Shares -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • AFFX

    DNA chip vendor Affymetrix (NASDAQ:AFFX) -16.6% AH after warning FQ2 revenues will be in...

    DNA chip vendor Affymetrix (NASDAQ:AFFX) -16.6% AH after warning FQ2 revenues will be in the range of $64M-$65M, compared with a consensus forecast of $74.1M. The company blames the shortfall on "decreased sales to academic customers across all regions." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • SWKS

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) rose 2.6% today on upgrades from Charter Equity and D.A. Davidson....

    Skyworks (NASDAQ:SWKS) rose 2.6% today on upgrades from Charter Equity and D.A. Davidson. Charter, previously bearish on the expectation of lower iPhone power amplifier sales, sees the bad news as baked in. D.A. Davidson is optimistic due to growing smartphone shipments and "overlooked markets like Chinese 3G data cards."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • FFHL

    After soaring over 55% early in the day, Fuwei Films (NASDAQ:FFHL) settles back in to close 28%...

    After soaring over 55% early in the day, Fuwei Films (NASDAQ:FFHL) settles back in to close 28% higher after announcing an agreement to become an exclusive supplier to Coca-Cola Bottling in China.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • WMS-OLD

    Gaming machine manufacturer WMS Industries (WMS-OLD -7%) continues its slide after Janney warns...

    Gaming machine manufacturer WMS Industries (WMS-OLD -7%) continues its slide after Janney warns the company is in a precarious spot competitively, and job cuts are likely in order.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • JASO

    JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO) shares are down 7.9% after being off as much as 18% following an...

    JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO) shares are down 7.9% after being off as much as 18% following an afternoon plunge. Volume is roughly 2x the stock's 3-month average, but no news has hit the wires to explain the drop. Other Chinese solar firms are also trading lower. SOL -3.4%. LDK -2.7%. TSL -4.3%. YGE -3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 9 Comments
  • ATMI

    ATMI (ATMI -4.1%) continues to weaken after D.A. Davidson cuts the shares to neutral. Based on...

    ATMI (ATMI -4.1%) continues to weaken after D.A. Davidson cuts the shares to neutral. Based on industry channel checks, Davidson "believes the wafer start forecasts at chip companies and leading foundries have had some downward bias over the past two months."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • ARCB

    Arkansas Best (ABFS +9.6%) pops after saying it will increase freight rates by 6.9%, and winning...

    Arkansas Best (ABFS +9.6%) pops after saying it will increase freight rates by 6.9%, and winning an appeal to continue a lawsuit seeking $750M in damages from the Teamsters and other trucking companies.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG) sinks 3.8% on reports that the company is evacuating its Marianas rig in...

    Transocean (NYSE:RIG) sinks 3.8% on reports that the company is evacuating its Marianas rig in West Africa; the company says only nonessential staff are being removed.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • DWA

    DreamWorks Animation (NASDAQ:DWA) is down 3.2%, as investors react to news of Viacom's...

    DreamWorks Animation (NASDAQ:DWA) is down 3.2%, as investors react to news of Viacom's (NYSE:VIA) Paramount division launching an in-house animation unit that will develop films with "budgets per picture of up to $100 million."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • RENN

    Social networking stocks are moving higher today, possibly due to yesterday's news of Twitter...

    Social networking stocks are moving higher today, possibly due to yesterday's news of Twitter closing a funding round at a valuation as high as $7B. RENN +9.4%. LNKD +3.2%. QPSA +2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • GILD

    Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS +6.4%) shares rise on renewed hopes for a hepatitis C drug after...

    Pharmasset (OTCPK:VRUS +6.4%) shares rise on renewed hopes for a hepatitis C drug after announcing a collaboration with Johnson & Johnson (JNJ -0.2%) to test their drugs together in a mid-stage human trial. Shares of competitor Vertex (VRTX -3.4%) slip, but have surged 40%-plus this year; also, Canaccord initiates coverage with a tepid Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +1.3%) faces a lawsuit from a company launched by a Groupon co-founder, accusing the...

    Yahoo (YHOO +1.3%) faces a lawsuit from a company launched by a Groupon co-founder, accusing the firm of hurting its stock by publishing inaccurate stock info. InnerWorkings demands an apology from Yahoo and correct financials posted online. Yahoo joins other online tech stocks higher: LNKD +3.1%, RENN +8.8%, QPSA +4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • OVTI

    JPMorgan steps in to rebut claims that OmniVision (OVTI -3.9%) may have lost its "lead supplier...

    JPMorgan steps in to rebut claims that OmniVision (OVTI -3.9%) may have lost its "lead supplier status" in supplying sensors for Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) next iPhone. Based on a chat with the CFO, JPMorgan thinks OVTI "is executing to plan, which includes ramping production of 8 MPx sensors on BSI-2 for tier 1 OEMs, including Apple," and predicts Y/Y revenue growth of 40% this quarter and 25% next.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • IBM

    Kenexa (KNXA +8.5%) shares jump on a report that the developer of human resources software has...

    Kenexa (KNXA +8.5%) shares jump on a report that the developer of human resources software has reached a resolution of a legal dispute with Taleo (TLEO -0.5%), which JMP Securities and Lazard say should add meaningfully to 2011 and 2012 earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM
  • CSH

    Cash America (CSH -4.7%) trades lower after Sidoti cuts to neutral on valuation. The firm notes...

    Cash America (CSH -4.7%) trades lower after Sidoti cuts to neutral on valuation. The firm notes the stock has substantially outperformed its peers as well as the broader market, and doesn't see any near-term catalyst to drive further upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • JVA

    Coffee Holding (JVA +10.4%) soars on volume 150% higher than normal. The firm rates a Buy from...

    Coffee Holding (JVA +10.4%) soars on volume 150% higher than normal. The firm rates a Buy from TheStreet Ratings, but shares of competitors lag behind today: Green Mountain (GMCR -0.4%), Starbucks (SBUX -0.9%), Tim Hortons ([[THI] -0.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 2 Comments
  • BCS

    Shares of Barclays (BCS -4.2%), Lloyds (LYG -1.9%) and RBS (RBS -3.6%) retreat on concerns...

    Shares of Barclays (BCS -4.2%), Lloyds (LYG -1.9%) and RBS (RBS -3.6%) retreat on concerns European banks stand in the crosshairs of even bigger problems than downgrades by ratings agencies of European sovereign debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • BORN

    After being pummelled over the past year due to accusations of financial fraud, investors...

    After being pummelled over the past year due to accusations of financial fraud, investors applaud China New Borun's (BORN +20%) announcement of adjustments to its auditing team.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • BGS

    Up 60% since January, B&G Foods (BGS -3.7%) is cut by Piper Jaffray as its price action...

    Up 60% since January, B&G Foods (BGS -3.7%) is cut by Piper Jaffray as its price action begins to show technical signs of fatigue.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • GDOT

    Green Dot (GDOT +4.8%) pops after Janney upgrades to Neutral based on the Fed's ruling on...

    Green Dot (GDOT +4.8%) pops after Janney upgrades to Neutral based on the Fed's ruling on interchange fees exempting the reloadable prepaid cards the firm offers to its customers. Janney sets a $35 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • BP

    The $7.2B deal between BP (BP -1.7%) and India's Reliance Industries moves closer to final...

    The $7.2B deal between BP (BP -1.7%) and India's Reliance Industries moves closer to final approval from India' cabinet, government sources say. The acquisition of a 30% stake in Reliance's 23 oil and gas blocks in India has been pending government approval since February. BP shares follow crude oil lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM

  • Sino-Forest (SNOFF.PK -11%) cancels a mid-July analyst trip set up to assure investors of the...

    Sino-Forest (SNOFF.PK -11%) cancels a mid-July analyst trip set up to assure investors of the scale of its holdings, likely trying to stall for time while an "independent" committee completes its report.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • NFLX

    What? A Netflix (NFLX -0.8%) downgrade? Merriman downgrades shares to Neutral, seeing limited...

    What? A Netflix (NFLX -0.8%) downgrade? Merriman downgrades shares to Neutral, seeing limited upside given "tough year-over-year operating margin comparisons, the potential for incremental EPS pressures from international launches and new/updated streaming content agreements." Merriman suggests rotating into Coinstar (CSTR -2%) as an alternative on the growing in-home movie craze.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • INTU

    Morgan Stanley's Adam Holt is cutting his rating on Intuit (INTU -1.2%) to Equal Weight from...

    Morgan Stanley's Adam Holt is cutting his rating on Intuit (INTU -1.2%) to Equal Weight from Overweight, citing a high valuation and the potential for slower growth in FY2012. Holt sees more upside in Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) and (interestingly enough, given its sky-high multiples) Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • KCI

    Kinetic Concepts (NYSE:KCI) is in negotiations on a P-E buyout. Shares halted (circuit breaker)...

    Kinetic Concepts (NYSE:KCI) is in negotiations on a P-E buyout. Shares halted (circuit breaker) +11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • LVB

    Steinway (NYSE:LVB) jumps +5% after its senior management makes an unsolicited proposal to...

    Steinway (NYSE:LVB) jumps +5% after its senior management makes an unsolicited proposal to purchase and take private the company's band instrument and online music divisions. In connection with the proposal, Chairman Kyle Kirkland has agreed to step down.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • HTCH

    Hutchinson Tech (NASDAQ:HTCH) pre-announces Q3 results, with shipments of suspension assemblies...

    Hutchinson Tech (NASDAQ:HTCH) pre-announces Q3 results, with shipments of suspension assemblies +15% vs. Q2, and Q4 likely to be even higher. Net sales of ~$72M vs. $65.5M consensus. "It appears that demand has shifted to some customer programs where we have stronger positions, and we believe that we are beginning to regain market share." Shares +18.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • EPRS

    After jumping yesterday, biotech firm Zalicus (ZLCS) is -5.3% to $2.49, with SA's Martin...

    After jumping yesterday, biotech firm Zalicus (ZLCS) is -5.3% to $2.49, with SA's Martin Shkreli, calling the stock a "great short," saying that fair value for the shares is actually $0.50-1.00.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • SODA

    SodaStream (SODA +7.3%) says it’s broken ground on a new 850,000 square foot manufacturing...

    SodaStream (SODA +7.3%) says it’s broken ground on a new 850,000 square foot manufacturing facility in Israel, and is expected to go live during 2013 at a cost of about €30M. The company, which manufactures beverage carbonation systems for use with tap water in the home, has 13 production facilities worldwide.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • PMIR

    PMI Group (PMI) is off to a healthy start, +10.3% after S&P's comments yesterday that the...

    PMI Group (PMI) is off to a healthy start, +10.3% after S&P's comments yesterday that the firm's mortgage insurer is likely to maintain solvency through at least Q2 2012. The ratings of both the unit and the parent company had been downgraded two notches and put under review last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • DRWI

    DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI) -8.2% premarket, after yesterday's AH announcement that it's parting...

    DragonWave (NASDAQ:DRWI) -8.2% premarket, after yesterday's AH announcement that it's parting ways with Brian McCormack, its global sales exec. No reason was given for the departure.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI) is down 7.7% on a report from FBR Capital suggesting the company may...

    OmniVision (NASDAQ:OVTI) is down 7.7% on a report from FBR Capital suggesting the company may have lost its "lead supplier status" for image sensor chips going into Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) next iPhone, with Sony (NYSE:SNE) taking OmniVision's place. Low manufacturing yields for OmniVision's new BSI-2 products are blamed for the setback.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • PARR

    Delta Petroleum (DPTR) jumps 6.7% after announcing it's exploring its strategic alternatives,...

    Delta Petroleum (DPTR) jumps 6.7% after announcing it's exploring its strategic alternatives, including a possible sale of the company, with an eye toward "maximizing shareholder value and dealing with 2012 debt maturities." It also closed a $43.2M sale of some non-core assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) is cut to neutral by Davenport, citing CEO visibility issues following...

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) is cut to neutral by Davenport, citing CEO visibility issues following Friday's resignation of Keith Calder, and weakening demand for coking coal due to record high prices. Shares -1.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM
  • PARR

    Premarket gainers: DPTR +7%. SODA +3%. RENN +3%. SZYM +3%.Losers: ZLCS -7%. OVTI -5%. BCS -4%....

    Premarket gainers: DPTR +7%. SODA +3%. RENN +3%. SZYM +3%.
    Losers: ZLCS -7%. OVTI -5%. BCS -4%. AIXG -4%. NBG -4%. STD -3%. SBNY -3%. ING -3%. CS -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • GFI

    In an effort to fund expansion and improve its debt profile, Gold Fields (NYSE:GFI) secures a...

    In an effort to fund expansion and improve its debt profile, Gold Fields (NYSE:GFI) secures a 5-year $1B revolving credit line with a consortium of 14 banks. The new funding replaces its existing $450M line, due to expire in 2013. Shares +1.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
  • MTEM

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) receives funding to begin phase 1 trials for its hypoxia...

    Threshold Pharmaceuticals (THLD) receives funding to begin phase 1 trials for its hypoxia activated prodrug TH-302. The study will determine the safety and effectiveness of using TH-302 in combination with Glaxo's (NYSE:GSK) Votrient in advanced solid tumors. THLD shares +2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • WPP

    WPP (WPPGY) gets cut to Equal Weight from Overweight at Morgan Stanley, which notes that...

    WPP (WPPGY) gets cut to Equal Weight from Overweight at Morgan Stanley, which notes that year-on-year comparisons will get significantly tougher in the second half of the year. The advertising firm will need an underlying acceleration to hit its targets for this year. Shares -2.8% in London.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:42 AM
